name: Hilton Belfast

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is great and marks it out from the run of the mill Hiltons. Amazingly friendly and helpful staff, lovely comfortable rooms, mine had a view over the Harland and Wolf shipyards - an amazing piece of Belfasts history.As in all Hiltons a really wonderful breakfast. Well placed for the city centre and CBD. I would also recommend a visit to St Georges Market opposite - a great combination of foodie mecca and street market - my only regret was that I didnt have more room in my suitcase to bring back some smoked salmon and some of the lovely cheeses I saw there.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - lovely staff who cant do enough for you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Small niggle for my stay was that the main restaurant was closed for a private function (just before xmas) so choice on the bar menu wasnt great, but the steak and chop we had was good quality and beautifully cooked. I would recommend this hotel unreservedly for anyone travelling for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Great hotel
Nice stay bar is nice
reviews.text: Being a local I rarely stay in a Belfast hotel. However I had the occasion to stay at the Hilton recently and was delighted with every aspect of it. Reception staff from Belfast and the States were exceptional, the food was first class and the bedroom was wonderful, We were on the 7th floor and had wonderful views over the Titanic Quarter and the Lagan River. Had a glorious walk along the river.
Altogether a great stay in my home city, There were a lot of visitors from the USA staying and they shared my views of the lovely hotel.
reviews.title: kind of expected

reviews.text: Check in was quick and easy. Room was clean and decent size with good view. We had a few drinks in the bar in the hotel and the service was quick and friendly with a nice atmosphere. The down side is the price of the car park - 18 pound (which is the cheaper price for hilton residents). For 73 pound for room only we would stay again.
reviews.title: A great home away from home...

description: The Hilton Belfast hotel has now completed a major refurbishment which includes all bedrooms, public areas and a gym by Precor - open 24/7. Next door to the Belfast Waterfront Hall, a few minutes walk to Belfast city centre and Victoria Square. 5 Minute walk to the Odyssey Arena. Wireless internet in all rooms (Charges may apply), 100% non smoking, Executive Floor, Executive Lounge, 1 Restaurant, 1 Bar, Fitness Centre/Health Club, Business Centre, Coffee shop, 198 Guest Rooms, Accessible Rooms, 9 Meeting Rooms. Check in: 3:00PM, Check out: 12:00PM. Parking available next door - car park for £18.00 per day.
